name: .NET SDK
about: Software Development Kits (SDK) in .NET (VB or C#) for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.

name: Paid Support Plans
about: Providing paid support tiers for developers to use, allowing them to pay by the minute, hour, or project, and get the intimate, direct support they desire.

name: Python SDK
about: Software Development Kits (SDK) in Python for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.

name: Node.js SDK
about: Software Development Kits (SDK) in Node.js for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.

name: Team Showcase
about: Provide a simple team page, showcasing the team behind the API, including photos, personal stories or bios, and any relevant social media accounts like Twitter and Github.

name: Windows Mobile SDK
about: Providing mobile focused SDKs for developers to build Windows mobile applications on top of an API.

name: Mobile Overview
about: An overview page, dedicated to mobile application development, giving equal time to each platform, including iOS, Android, and Windows.

name: JavaScript SDK
about: Software Development Kits (SDK) in JavaScript for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.

name: Documentation Language
about: Use a query string lang= parameter to set the language the API documentation should be speaking.

name: Documentation
about: Simple, easy to understand, documentation of what an API does, that is kept up to date with API roadmap.

name: Blog
about: Providing a blog dedicated to API platform operations, with stories about the providers, consumers, and other related stories.

name: Forum
about: A modern, up to date, active, and well monitored forum, providing self-service access to information about an APIs operation.

name: Case Studies
about: Offering a wealth of case studies of actual implementations that have occurred with an API , showing potential consumers what is possible.

name: Status Dashboard
about: A single location, at dedicated subdomain, providing status update(s) for all API resources, giving developers a place to go when looking to see if platform is available.

name: Terms of Service
about: Terms of Use provide a legal framework for developers to operate within, protecting the platforms interest, while also enabling potential innovation.

name: Labs
about: Offering a labs environment, that showcases ideas that are being developed internally and by partners, possibly even providing opportunities for public consumers.

name: Widgets
about: Widgets are highly functional, API driven JavaScript tools that provide portable applications that can be embedded on any website or application.

name: Rate Limits Page
about: Provide a single page explaining how rate limits for a platform works, setting expectations with API consumers about how their consumption of APIs will be impacted.

name: Authentication Overview
about: An overview of how authentication is handled for a platform, and which formats are supported, setting expectations for consumers.

name: Github
about: Using Github for managing of code samples, libraries, SDKs, and other supporting elements of an API platform.

name: Sandbox
about: Provide developers a sandbox environment to develop and test their code, reducing headaches for consumers when developing their applications.

name: Pricing
about: A single page that outlines what an API costs, providing details on what consumers get with API calls, and what they will cost.

name: iOS SDK
about: Providing mobile focused SDKs for developers to build IOS mobile applications on top of an API.

name: Developer Dashboard
about: Provide developers a single dashboard for getting at all their tools, metrics and information they need to successfully manage their usage.

name: Terms of Service
about: Provide loose enough terms of service, that users can migrate their data from one platform to another, without violating the terms of service.

name: Email
about: Providing a simple email address that API consumers can use when looking to get answers to their questions.

name: Portal
about: A simple, easily accessible portal for engaging with API consumers, providing a single point of entry for all API engagements.

name: Wordpress
about: Providing ready to go WordPress integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use through their WordPress site(s).

name: Angular.js
about: Providing developers with AngularJS framework integration, allowing them to build single page applications using API resources.

name: PHP SDK
about: Software Development Kits (SDK) in PHP for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.

name: Security Overview
about: Offer an overview page outlining the security practices, and technology used by a platform demonstrating the security practices of the platform, and what is expected of developers.

name: User Management
about: A user management API, enabling the ability to create, read, update, and delete information associated with a specific user.

name: Ideas
about: Like showcase existing applications, an idea showcase is about providing a place where new and existing ideas can be shared, and potentially built upon by the community.

name: Roadmap
about: A detailed list of what additions and changes are being planned as part of API operations, giving consumers a place where they can go learn about what is next in an APIs evolution.

name: How-to Guides
about: Providing how-to guides that walk consumers through common aspects of API integration, giving them self-service resources they can use.

name: Privacy Policy
about: Privacy policies protect the rights of partners, developers and platform users while also protecting the API owner from damaging activity via the API platform.

name: Application Gallery
about: A gallery of all applications that have been built on top of an API platform, for the public and API community to explore.

name: Getting Started
about: Laying out simple, clear steps for developers on how to register, authenticate, access documentation and code samples, and get support and any other details that are essential to integration.

name: List of Endpoints
about: A simple listing of all endpoints provides a quick introduction of what is available with an API.

name: Android SDK
about: Providing mobile focused SDKs for developers to build Android mobile applications on top of an API.

name: Service Tiers
about: A clear breakdown of any different service tiers that are available for API operations, with features available for each level of access.

name: Production
about: Offer a production environment in addition to a sandbox, allowing developers to push an application into production mode when it is ready.

name: Account Settings
about: Provide developers access to their basic account detail and settings, giving them quick access to their account configuration and allow for easy updates.

name: Data Portability
about: Providing users with the ability to get data out of a system through a bulk download and via an API in a usable format that employs open standards.

name: Blog RSS Feed
about: Make sure there is an RSS feed for any blog that is published as part of API operations.

name: Contact Form
about: A contact form available in the central API portal, that developers can use to ask questions.

name: Heroku
about: Providing ready to go Heroku integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use through their Heroku platform account.

name: Key Access
about: Providing simple tokens, often called API key as a common way to access to APIs, issuing one to each developer and per application they register.

name: Forum RSS
about: Going beyond just a forum, and providing an RSS feed for all forum activity.

name: Rate Limit Information Inline In Docs
about: In addition to a rate limits page, provide information about limitations on API usage, some API providers like Twitter are including rate limits within API documentation.

name: Account Management
about: An account management API, enabling users to create, read, update, and delete information associated with their account.

name: White Papers
about: Offer white papers that educate consumers around topics that are relevant to the platform, consumers, and the industry that is being operated in.

name: Branding
about: Branding Guidelines set the tone for how partners and developers can use the resources and assets made available via an API, setting expectations of how the brand can be use.

name: Twitter
about: Provide an active Twitter account for support, as well as evangelism efforts around an APIs operations.

name: Change Log
about: A detailed list of changes have been made to an API platform, giving consumers a single place they can go to learn about what changes have been made.

name: Self-Service Registration
about: Providing a self-service registration for a developer portal, allowing developers to signup and get access to an API, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

name: Badges
about: Badges are common for displaying content and resources delivered via an API and allow these assets to be embedded on any website or application.

name: Interactive Documentation
about: Interactive, hands-on documentation, provided by common approaches like Swagger and API Blueprint.

name: Open Source
about: Using open source licenses across any code samples, libraries, SDKs, and complete applications provided as part of aPI operations.

name: HTML5
about: Providing mobile focused SDKs for developers to build HTML5 mobile applications on top of an API.

name: Stack Overflow
about: Using the public QA site Stack Overflow as part of support operations for an API.

name: Phone
about: Providing a phone number that developers can call when they need support.

name: Opportunities
about: Providing an area where aPI consumers can find opportunities available on the platform from potential projects, to posting job opportunities that are currently available.

name: Reset Password
about: Provide the necessary tools for developers to gain access to their account if they lose their password.

name: Automation
about: Offer ready to go integrations with popular API automation platforms like Zapier and IFTTT, allowing any user to migrate data between platforms.

name: Drupal
about: Providing ready to go Drupal integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use through their Drupal site(s).

name: Ruby SDK
about: Software Development Kits (SDK) in Ruby for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.

name: Simulator
about: Providing an environment where developers can find existing profiles, templates or other collections of data, as well as sequence for simulating a particular experience via an API platform.

name: Basic Auth
about: Usage of the basic authentication format that is part of the standard HTTP operations, employing a username and password as credentials for accessing API resources.

name: Account Rate Limit API
about: Provide an API for accessing the rate limits for an API platform, as well as where a user or their apps stand with usage at any point in time.

name: Application Management
about: An application management API, allowing users to manage their registered applications, and get information about their consumption.

name: Ticket System
about: Provide a central ticketing system for all support requests, possibly using popular support software like Zendesk.

name: Email
about: Provide an email for not just support, but also general platform communications.

name: Application Manager
about: Providing an interface that allows developers to manage one or many applications that will be integrating with an API.

name: API Explorer
about: API explorers allow users to make calls and explore REST APIs using a web interface.

name: Best Practices
about: Publishing of a plain english introduction to the best practices around integrating with an API, providing introductory lesson for developers of how to properly integrate with an API.

name: Starter Projects
about: Offer fully functional applications that API developers can reverse engineer, and possible put to use as a starting point for their integrations.

name: Appery.io
about: Providing mobile focused SDKs for developers to build mobile applications on top of an API, using Appery.io.

name: Webinars
about: Provide online webinars on a regular basis that API consumers can attend to learn about various aspects of platform operations.

name: oAuth
about: Provides an identify and access layer for API driven resource, one that allows for reciprocity to occur within a single API ecosystem, and between multiple ecosystems.

name: Code License
about: Provide a license for the code that is available via the platform setting expectations with consumers regarding how they can use code within their businesses, while also protecting API providers intellectual property.

name: Widget Builder
about: A widget builder provides a form that API consumers can use to configure a predefined widget that is integrated with an API, allowing them to customize and tailor the widget experience.

name: Partner Program
about: A formal, public, and documented partnership program for consumers to get higher levels of access to API and platform resources.

name: Status RSS
about: Providing an RSS feed for a status dashboard, allowing users to receive updates on any website, and via any RSS client.

name: SalesForce
about: Providing ready to go SalesForce integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use through their SalesForce account.

name: oAuth
about: Providing an oAuth layer to API operations, securing high value APIs, while also opening up a conversation between an API platform, developers, and end-users regarding the access of their content and data.

name: Knowledgebase
about: Providing a single repository of content, organized by title, and tag, allowing you to search for keywords and phrases, as well as browse for answers.

name: Service Management
about: A service management API, providing users to see what services are available, and their access and usage levels for any given service.

name: Templates
about: Offering predefined templates ofu00a0operation, when a new environment is setup, either sandbox, production, or simulator, it can be pre-populated with data, and other configuration.

name: FAQ
about: Providing developers a list of the common questions asked of an API platform, with simple answers to each question, allowing them to understand the common problems faced during onboarding.

name: LinkedIn
about: Provide an active LinkedIn account for support, as well as evangelism efforts around an APIs operations.

name: Buttons
about: Buttons are shareable snippets of code that often share, syndicate or trigger a variety of events that use APIs as their source.

name: Error Response Codes
about: Provide a robust, complete, clear and meaningful list of API error response codes.

name: Office Hours
about: Dedicated a specific time each week or monthly where support staff will be available via live chat to answer questions.

name: Usage Logs & Analytics
about: Allowing developers to be able to see where they stand with usage, logging and other aspects of operations, by providing them reports and analytics of their history.

name: Data License
about: Provide a data license to set the expectations with API consumers regarding how they can use data, and also protects API providers and their partners intellectual property.

name: Events
about: Publish a page with information about any events the an API program will be attending, or maybe links to video and slide decks from past conferences.

name: Java SDK
about: Software Development Kits (SDK) in Java for developers to use when integrating with their applications in the language they are familiar with. SDKs should be expected to be used in production environments.

name: Integrations
about: Integrations showcase other 3rd party platforms that an API provider is already connected to, providing ready to go platform integration solutions that any developer can take advantage of.

name: Community Supported Libraries
about: In addition to providing your own company developed libraries, showcasing the libraries of trusted developers fro within the API community.

name: Joomla
about: Providing ready to go Joomla integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use through their Joomla account.

name: Reseller
about: A formal program for managing resellers of products and services sold via APIs, with revenue sharing opportunities.

name: OAuth Scopes
about: Providing a dedicated page or section to listing out the differen OAuth scopes used by a platform.

name: Calendar
about: A single calendar of all events related to API operations, providing a place where developers can find all related goings on.

name: Facebook
about: Provide an active Facebook account for support, as well as evangelism efforts around an APIs operations.

name: Authentication Tester
about: Providing a testing tool for authentication, that allows developers to test key and Basic Auth to oAuth, to help them understand how authentication works and if they are using proper credentials.

name: Billing History
about: Provide clear and easy access to what a developer has been billed, allowing them to access and download their billing history around API usage.

name: Service Accord
about: Service level agreements (SLA) provide a legal framework managing the relationships between API consumers, and service accords provide a plain english explanation of what they expect from a provider, without the legaleze, in a format they can understand without calling the lawyers.

name: Service Level Agreement
about: Provide a service level agreements (SLA) describing what service(s) are offered by an API provider, with details about quality of service, warranties,u00a0disaster recovery, and steps foru00a0termination of agreement.

name: Google App Engine
about: Providing ready to go Google App Engine integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use through the Google Cloud platform.

name: Slideshare
about: Publish a list of slide decks available on a Slideshare account, providing developers with access to past talks the API program has done.

name: Code Builder
about: A tool allowing for the generation of client code for various API endpoint, for specific language or platform objectives.

name: JavaScript API
about: A complete JavaScript API that developers can use to build and manage their own JavaScript integrations with an APIs resources, beyond existing widgets.

name: Volume Pricing
about: Providing additional layers of pricing based upon volume purchases, allowing users to better understand their API usage and potentially buy in bulk based upon their past habits.

name: Google+
about: Provide an active Google+ account for support, as well as evangelism efforts around an APIs operations.

name: Deprecation Policy
about: Provide a API deprecation policy setting expectations with API consumers about when and how API resources will be deprecated and shut down.

name: Chrome Extension
about: Providing ready to go Google Chrome browser integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use in their browser, with a Google Chrome extension.

name: Codecademy
about: Creating courses on Codecademy, then publishing them within an API developer area, providing lessons for developers on how an API operates.

name: Message Center
about: Providing developers with a messaging system within their developer accounts, and communicate with API providers, and receive system updates.

name: Sign Up Email
about: Providing a simple, informative, personal email immediately upon signup, letting developers know what they need to onboard.

name: Certification Program
about: Allowing developer to get certified, providing a verified layer of developers that can be used by the platform, and ecosystem partners.

name: Code
about: A page dedicated to providing access to code resources, whether samples, libraries, SDKs, PDKs, or starter projects.

name: Email Newsletter
about: An email newsletter dedicated to cover news across platform operations, providing weekly summary of activity in the inbox.

name: Firefox Add-On
about: Providing ready to go Mozilla Firefox browser integration, allowing developers, and sometimes even non-developers to immediately put an API to use in their browser, with a Mozilla Firefox add-on.

name: Google Authentication
about: Allowing developers to create their API account using their Google account, and allowing the to login in the future using their Google oAuth.

name: Github Authentication
about: Allow developers to create and login to their API developer account using their own Github account credentials.

name: Monetization Guidelines
about: Providing legal guidelines for how developers can monetize around resources that are available via an API.

name: Tour
about: Providing a guided tour of how a platform and API operates, allowing new developers to walk through all aspects of operations in an interactive or video format.

name: Github Authentication
about: Allowing developers to create their API account using their Github account, and allowing the to login in the future using their Github oAuth.

name: Delete Account
about: Giving developers the ability to delete their account from within their account portal.

name: Compliance
about: A page providing compliance related information, covering how a company, platform, and APIs complies with government and industry regulations.

name: Glossary
about: A glossary of terms that applies to an industry, platform, and the business or technical aspects of operations, providing API consumers who may not be familiar with sector or platform specific terms, with a dictionary they can use during integration.

name: Instagram
about: Using Instagram as a way to communicate with platform users, and let users know there is someone home.

name: Videos
about: Provides video resources, helping people understand the API platform, how it can be put to use, and any other supporting areas of API operations.

name: Service Tier Management
about: Allow developers to change the service tier they operate with in via their developer dashboard, without having to request changes from platform support.

name: Facebook Authentication
about: Allowing developers to create their API account using their Facebook account, and allowing the to login in the future using their Facebook credentials.

name: Vimeo
about: Using Vimeo as a communication channel for educating users about an API platform.

name: Internationalization
about: Provide resources that help developers localize, and internationalize their applications to meet the needs of specific global markets.

name: Youtube
about: Using Youtube as a regular content and communication channel to help users learn about platform operations.

name: Chat
about: Providing a live chant mechanism in the developer portal, allowing developers to connect directly with API support and evangelists.
